intro: Chiritopsis longzhouensis, commonly known as the Longzhou chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or rocky habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in small heads. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
